oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uniform coat of John William Batterham Lindsey
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Wool officer's coat and cap of John William Batterham Lindsey of Chattanooga. His coat has a tag reading "By/The House of Kuppenheimer/for/Crutcher & Starks/LOUISVILLE." The silk lined officer's cap also is labeled to Crutcher & Starks. He joined the army as a private while still a student at the Univ. of Tenn. He was appointed as a 2nd lieutenant on August 31, 1918 in the 96th Field Artillery and later the 66th Field Artillery. He worked as ageneral contractor in Chattanooga after the war.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Lindsey, John William Batterham
